title: Apple has no more markets left to conquer
text: Apple is one of the world’s highest-quality businesses. Its smartphones are the most popular on the market and in the past decade it has grown into a leader in wearable technology, from the Apple Watch to AirPods. This has rewarded shareholders handsomely, with returns of more than 200 per cent in the past five years. But the nagging question remains at the back of investors’ minds: can Apple really keep growing at this rate? The concern has stalked Apple for years, but a lawsuit filed by the US Department of Justice last week could mark an inflection point. It alleges that Apple has reached its “astronomical valuation” of $2.6 trillion more by “making it harder or more expensive for its users and developers to leave, © Times Media Limited 2024.
